title: How to Make Salted Cucumbers

steps.headline: Place a jar on the counter.
steps.description: On the bottom of the jar, layer some dill, garlic, currant leaves and radish leaf.

steps.headline: Place the cucumbers in the jar tightly.
steps.description: Do not force in so many that you crush them though.

steps.headline: Make a pickle.
steps.description: Boil water with salt and a few grains of black pepper. Do not put too much salt. Take a proportion: 2 tablespoons of salt on 1 liter of water. Cool the pickle a little, then pour it into the jar.

steps.headline: Leave the jar in a warm place.
steps.description: A day later, the salted cucumbers will be ready.

steps.headline: Pour cold pickle over the cucumbers in a jar.
steps.description: Then leave it in the kitchen. You will have good crispy salted cucumbers after 2 days.

steps.headline: When cucumbers are ready, cover them and put into a fridge.
Cut cucumbers lengthwise into two pieces and place in a bowl.
Peel a few cloves of garlic.
Put the garlic and dill with the cucumbers.
Salt the mixture and mix it by hand, so that all ingredients are well-balanced.
steps.description: Put the mixed cucumbers in a polythene bag and tie it, pre-releasing all the air.

steps.headline: Leave it for an hour.
steps.description: After an hour, the salted cucumbers are ready.

steps.headline: Slice cucumbers in two or four pieces, or chop across in large chunks.
Put the slices or chunks in a plastic container with a lid.
Chop some fresh dill, a few cloves of garlic and a piece of radish root.
steps.description: Put the chopped ingredients in with the cucumbers.

steps.headline: Salt the contents of the container.
steps.description: Then close tightly with a lid.

steps.headline: Strongly shake the container for a couple of minutes.

tyn: Polythene bag or container with lid
